titles.title: Curated version with enhanced documentation and reproducible workflow

descriptions.description: This is a curated version of the AI4I 2020 Predictive Maintenance Dataset, enhanced with comprehensive metadata, quality documentation, and reproducible transformation workflows. The dataset contains 10,000 synthetic records of industrial machine sensor readings designed for predictive maintenance research and education. This curated version includes detailed provenance tracking, data quality assessments, and guidance for handling class imbalance and potential biases inherent in synthetic data.

The dataset was generated synthetically using physics-based failure models representing five failure modes: Tool Wear Failure (TWF), Heat Dissipation Failure (HDF), Power Failure (PWF), Overstrain Failure (OSF), and Random Failure (RNF). The curation process involved comprehensive quality assessment, feature normalization using StandardScaler, outlier detection and documentation, and creation of structured metadata following DataCite Schema 4.4.

IMPORTANT LIMITATIONS: This is a synthetic dataset that may not fully capture real-world industrial complexity. It exhibits severe class imbalance (96.61% normal vs 3.39% failure) and high multicollinearity between temperature features. The data generation code is not publicly available, limiting full reproducibility of the source data. Users should validate findings on real industrial data before production deployment.

Product ID.description: Product identifier consisting of letter (L/M/H) and serial number

Air temperature [K].description: Ambient air temperature measured in Kelvin

Process temperature [K].description: Process temperature generated by adding 10K to air temperature plus random noise

Rotational speed [rpm].description: Tool rotational speed in revolutions per minute

Tool wear [min].description: Tool wear duration in minutes (quality variants affect usage)
Tool wear [min].note: H variant adds 5 minutes, M adds 3 minutes, L adds 2 minutes

Machine failure.description: Binary target variable indicating machine failure (0=normal, 1=failure)

TWF.description: Tool Wear Failure flag (failure occurs if tool wear between 200-240 minutes)

HDF.description: Heat Dissipation Failure flag (failure if temp difference <8.6K and speed <1380rpm)

PWF.description: Power Failure flag (failure if power (torqueÃ—speed) <3500W or >9000W)

OSF.description: Overstrain Failure flag (failure if product of tool wear and torque exceeds thresholds)

known_biases.description: Failure events constitute only 3.39% of records, which may lead models to optimize for normal operation detection rather than failure prediction
known_biases.mitigation: Users should employ techniques such as SMOTE, class weighting, or ensemble methods designed for imbalanced classification

known_biases.description: Dataset does not capture full complexity of real industrial environments including sensor noise, environmental factors, or gradual degradation patterns
known_biases.mitigation: Findings should be validated on real-world data before production deployment

known_biases.description: The five selected features reflect assumptions about relevant failure predictors that may not generalize across all industrial contexts
known_biases.mitigation: Consider domain knowledge and additional sensors when applying to specific industrial applications

known_biases.description: High correlation between air temperature and process temperature (r=0.88) may affect feature importance in some models
known_biases.mitigation: Consider dimensionality reduction or feature selection techniques

appropriate_uses: Benchmarking machine learning algorithms for predictive maintenance
Testing data curation and preprocessing workflows
inappropriate_uses: Direct deployment to production industrial systems without validation
Safety-critical applications without real-world data verification
Claims about real-world industrial system performance

citation.apa: Shah, H. (2025). AI4I 2020 Predictive Maintenance Dataset (Curated) [Dataset]. University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign. https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.XXXXXXX
